alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 2:43AM MDT until May 14 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Doppler radar has indicated 1 to 2 inches of rain has already fallen in the effected area. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 545 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 240 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Hot Springs County. Some basins include Jones Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
